intro: Coronopus rhytidocarpus, commonly known as the rough-leaved coronopus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
